content.user_title: Generate molecular features for ML models
content.value_statement: You need consistent molecular features for QSAR or screening tasks. This skill guides featurizer selection and shows how to produce embeddings and fingerprints.
actual_capabilities: Convert SMILES to fingerprints using FPCalculator
Batch featurize datasets with MoleculeTransformer and n_jobs
List and search featurizers with ModelStore
Save and reload transformer configs to YAML or JSON
limitations: Requires molfeat and optional extras for some models
Pretrained transformers can be slow on first run
Does not train or evaluate ML models by itself
Memory use grows with dataset size

prompt_templates.title: Pick a featurizer
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a starter featurizer for SMILES property prediction and explain why it fits.

prompt_templates.title: Batch featurize
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to featurize a SMILES list in parallel and handle invalid molecules.

prompt_templates.title: Use pretrained model
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide steps to generate ChemBERTa embeddings and cache results for reuse.

prompt_templates.title: Compare featurizers
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a fair comparison plan for ECFP, RDKit descriptors, and ChemBERTa on a QSAR dataset.

output_examples.input: I need a fast baseline featurizer for QSAR and a quick way to scale it.
output: Use ECFP fingerprints as a fast baseline with 2048 bits
Wrap the calculator in MoleculeTransformer with n_jobs set to all cores
Enable ignore_errors if you have noisy SMILES
Save the transformer config to YAML for reproducibility

best_practices: Start with ECFP or MACCS before deep models
Cache embeddings when using pretrained transformers
Save featurizer configs for reproducible runs
anti_patterns: Using large pretrained models without required extras
Skipping error handling on noisy SMILES

faq.question: Is this compatible with my Python setup?
faq.answer: It documents molfeat usage and works with Python environments that can install molfeat and its extras.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Large datasets and pretrained models can be slow and memory heavy without batching or caching.

faq.question: Can I integrate with scikit-learn or PyTorch?
faq.answer: Yes, examples show scikit-learn pipelines and PyTorch dataset usage.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, the skill content is documentation and does not include data collection or network exfiltration.

faq.question: What if I see errors on invalid SMILES?
faq.answer: Use ignore_errors and verbose to skip invalid entries and log failures.

faq.question: How does it compare to other featurizers?
faq.answer: It covers fingerprints, descriptors, and pretrained embeddings in one library with a shared interface.
